page.title: 08Items Of Local Concern
page.content: In a survey conducted in Kennethmont 60% of the ratepayers in this area felt that they did not get "value for money" in terms of services provided by local government. The main complaints concerned the roads and especially snow clearance ,in winter, of minor roads, some roads often being uncleared for hours. There were also complaints about snow not being cleared from the pavement running from Kirkhill to the school, as this often forced children to walk to school on the main road. Refuse collection was another source of complaints and some residents wanted a phone box provided at Kirkhill and public toilets at the playing field.59% of those asked thought that the present rating system should be abolished and that a fairer system could be devised for financing local government.
